contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox airport | name = Zanesville Municipal Airport | image = | IATA = ZZV | ICAO = KZZV | FAA = ZZV | type = Public | owner = City of Zanesville | operator = | city-served = [[Zanesville, Ohio]] | location = <!--if different than above--> | elevation-f = 900 | website = | latd = 39 | latm = 56 | lats = 40 | latNS = N | longd = 081 | longm = 53 | longs = 32 | longEW = W | coordinates_region = US-OH | pushpin_map = USA Ohio | pushpin_map_caption = Location of airport in Ohio | pushpin_label = '''ZZV''' | r1-number = 4/22 | r1-length-f = 5,000 | r1-surface = Asphalt/Concrete | r2-number = 16/34 | r2-length-f = 4,999 | r2-surface = Asphalt/Concrete | stat-year = 2011 | stat1-header = Aircraft operations | stat1-data = 33,312 | stat2-header = Based aircraft | stat2-data = 18 | footnotes = Source: [[Federal Aviation Administration]]<ref name="FAA">{{FAA-airport|ID=ZZV|use=PU|own=PU|site=18761.*A}}. Federal Aviation Administration. Effective November 15, 2012.</ref> }} '''Zanesville Municipal Airport''' {{airport codes|ZZV<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx | title = IATA Airport Code Search (ZZV: Zanesville) | publisher = [[International Air Transport Association]] | accessdate = December 17, 2012}}</ref>|KZZV|ZZV}} is a city owned, public use [[airport]] located five [[nautical mile]]s (6 [[mile|mi]], 9 [[kilometre|km]]) east of the [[central business district]] of [[Zanesville, Ohio|Zanesville]], a city in [[Muskingum County, Ohio]], United States.<ref name="FAA" /> It is included in the [[National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems]] for 2011–2015, which [[FAA airport categories|categorized]] it as a ''[[general aviation]]'' facility.<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/npias/reports/media/2011/npias_2011_appA.pdf | title = 2011–2015 NPIAS Report, Appendix A | format = [[PDF]], 2.03 MB | work = [http://www.faa.gov/airports/planning_capacity/npias/reports/index.cfm?sect=2011 National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems] | publisher = Federal Aviation Administration | date = October 4, 2010 }} </ref> == Facilities and aircraft == Zanesville Municipal Airport covers an area of 534 [[acre]]s (216 [[hectare|ha]]) at an [[elevation]] of 900 feet (274 m) above [[mean sea level]]. It has two [[runway]]s with [[asphalt]] and [[concrete]] surfaces: 4/22 is 5,000 by 150 feet (1,524 x 46 m) and 16/34 is 4,999 by 150 feet (1,524 x 46 m).<ref name="FAA" /> For the 12-month period ending May 24, 2011, the airport had 33,312 aircraft operations, an average of 91 per day: 96% [[general aviation]], 3% [[air taxi]], and 1% [[military aviation|military]]. At that time there were 18 aircraft based at this airport: 56% single-[[aircraft engine|engine]], 33% multi-engine, and 11.1% [[jet aircraft|jet]].<ref name="FAA" /> == References == <references /> == External links == * [http://www.zanesvilleaviation.com/fbo.html Aanesville Aviation], the [[fixed base operator]] (FBO) * [http://msrmaps.com/map.aspx?t=1&s=11&lat=39.9449&lon=-81.8921&w=700&h=850&lp=---+None+--- Aerial image as of April 1994] from [[USGS]] ''[[The National Map]]'' * {{FAA-procedures|ZZV}} * {{US-airport-ga|ZZV}} [[Category:Airports in Ohio]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Zanesville, Ohio]] [[Category:Transportation in Muskingum County, Ohio]]
